The sonnet is at the ending of Shakespeare sequenzesequence about the young men.
The narrator of the sonnet speaks about his opinion of love.
As a result he comes to the conclusion that after his opinion no one has ever loved.
In the first quatrain he says that love is not transitory.
It also shouldn't change with the time.
There should never be obstacles in a good relationship.
So the people should watch after this.
In the next quartrainquatrain the personal speaker describes Lovelove as an option for finding the right way in life.
Especially for people who don't know who their self are love gives them a good direction.
They don't have to take the way Lovelove says but they can.
Quartrainquatrain number three says that real Lovelove never getgets lost or changechanges.
If love is transitory it's not because of the time.
Real love exists until being death.
The closing couplet is about the paradox of the personal speaker.
After his definition of love he comes to the conclusion that no one ever loved.
All in all Sonnet 116 is about the idea of love from the personal speaker.
